Parameter.Comment: Percentage of sampling time allowed before a warning bit is set
Parameter.Name: percentage of interrupt used Warning

Parameter.Comment: Percentage of sampling time used to give a Fault in the Application Layer
Parameter.Name: percentage of interrupt used Fault

Parameter.Comment: 0: No Parameter Identification Run at start-up 1: ID Run at start-up requested
Parameter.Name: ID Run request

Parameter.Comment: 0: No Pulse-testing of transistors 1: Pulse-testing of transistors required
Parameter.Name: Pulse Testing

Parameter.Comment: 0: Remote selection of Control Mode not allowed 1: Remote selection of Control Mode allowed
Parameter.Name: Remote Allowed

Parameter.Comment: 0: Watch View 1: ModBus 2: High Speed Link 3: Display
Parameter.Name: Reference Source

Parameter.Comment: 0: Torque Control 1: Speed Control 2: Power Control 3: DC-link Voltage Control 4: Load Emulator
Parameter.Name: Control Mode

Parameter.Comment: Time constant of the 1st order reference filter
Parameter.Name: Filter Time constant

Parameter.Comment: Time to increase from 0 to 1pu at 1 pu input signal. Increase from 0 to either positive or negative value.
Parameter.Name: Ramp Time increase

Parameter.Comment: Time to decrease from 1 pu value to 0 pu input signal. the same decrease time used from -1 pu value to 0 pu input signal.
Parameter.Name: Ramp Time decrease

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the output of the ramp-filter and the actual value to be controlled is larger than the Max deviation, the output of the ramp-filter will not change.
Parameter.Name: Max deviation

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the input to the ramp-filter and the output of the filter is less than this value, the filter will become a 1st order low pass filter.
Parameter.Name: Max error

Parameter.Comment: 0: Torque Ramp function is not allowed to be used (but 1st order low pass) 1: Torque Ramp function is allowed to be used
Parameter.Name: Torque Ramp Allowed

Parameter.Comment: 0: Also 1st order filter can be used 1: Ramp-filter is always chosen if allowed
Parameter.Name: Torque Ramp Fixed Selected

Parameter.Comment: This is the global max limit for the torque. This limit can be due to gear box/transmissions, etc.
Parameter.Name: Max Torque

Parameter.Comment: Global minimum torque allowed.
Parameter.Name: Min Torque

Parameter.Comment: Time constant of the 1st order reference filter
Parameter.Name: Speed Filter Time constant

Parameter.Comment: Time to increase from 0 to 1 pu at 1 pu input signal. Increase from 0 to either positive or negative value.
Parameter.Name: Speed Ramp Time increase

Parameter.Comment: Time to decrease from 1 to 0 pu at 0 pu input signal. The same decrease time used from -1 pu value to 0 input signal.
Parameter.Name: Speed Ramp Time decrease

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the output of the ramp-filter and the actual speed is larger than the max deviation, the output of the ramp-filter will not be changed. The integration is stopped.
Parameter.Name: Max Speed deviation

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the input to the ramp-filter and the output of the filter is less than this Max speed error, the filter will become a 1st order low pass filter.
Parameter.Name: Max speed error

Parameter.Comment: 0: Speed Ramp filter is not allowed to be used, but a 1st order lowpass filter 1: Speed Ramp filter is allowed to be used
Parameter.Name: Speed Ramp Allowed

Parameter.Comment: 0: Also 1st order filter can be selected 1: Ramp-filter is always chosen if allowed
Parameter.Name: Speed Ramp Fixed Selected

Parameter.Comment: Increase time not active during Quick Stop
Parameter.Name: Quick Stop Ramp Time increase

Parameter.Comment: This is the critical value when stopping the drive by Quick Stop. This value will usually be short, but is dependent on the load in the actual application.
Parameter.Name: Quick Stop Ramp Time decrease

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the output of the ramp-filter and the actual speed is larger than this max deviation parameter, the output of the ramp-filter will not change. The integration is stopped.
Parameter.Name: Quick Stop Max Speed deviation

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the input to the ramp-filter and the output of the ramp-filer is less than this Max speed error parameter, the filter will become a 1st order filter.
Parameter.Name: Quick Stop Max speed error

Parameter.Comment: When the absolute value of the actual speed becomes less than this value, the status-bit NOT_QUICK_STOP is set equal TRUE. The Application State Machine the goes automatically from the state QUICK_STOP_ACTIVE to the state SWITCH_ON_DISABLED.
Parameter.Name: Stop Quick Stop Speed limit

Parameter.Comment: This is the proportional gain of a PI controller.
Parameter.Name: Gain Kp Speed Controller

Parameter.Comment: Usually equal 0 in the speed controller
Parameter.Name: Feedforward Gain Kv Speed Controller

Parameter.Comment: This time constant for the PI(D) controller can be calculated based on Symmetrical Optimum or other design rules. The controller parameters are very dependent on the actual application.
Parameter.Name: Integral Time constant Speed Controller

Parameter.Comment: NOT IN USE in the the controller today, but can be used when going out limitation / Anti-Windup.
Parameter.Name: Filter Time Speed Controller

Parameter.Comment: Time constant of the 1st order filter
Parameter.Name: Power Filter Time constant

Parameter.Comment: Time to increase from 0 to 1pu at 1 pu input signal. Increase from 0 to either positive or negative value.
Parameter.Name: Power Ramp Time increase

Parameter.Comment: Time to decrease from 1 pu to 0 pu input signal. The same decrease time used from -1 pu to 0 pu input signal.
Parameter.Name: Power Ramp Time decrease

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the output of the ramp-filter and the actual power is larger than the max deviation, the output of the ramp-filter will not change. The integration is stopped.
Parameter.Name: Max Power deviation

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the input and output of the ramp-filter is less than this value, the filter will become a 1st order filter,
Parameter.Name: Max power error

Parameter.Comment: 0: Power Ramp filter is not allowed to be used, but a 1st order lowpass filter 1: Power Ramp filter is allowed to be used
Parameter.Name: Power Ramp Allowed

Parameter.Comment: 0: Also 1st order lowpass filter can be selected 1: Ramp-filter is always selected if allowed
Parameter.Name: Power Ramp Fixed Selected

Parameter.Comment: This is the global max limit for the power. This limitation could be du to input rectifier or limitation in supply.
Parameter.Name: Max Power

Parameter.Comment: This is max allowed power into the grid, i.e. from the drive to the supply. If a diode rectifier is used at the input this may be 0, or a small value if a brake chopper is installed. it can also be limitations in the power the supply can absorb.
Parameter.Name: Min Power

Parameter.Comment: Time constant of the 1st order lowpass filter
Parameter.Name: Udcref Filter Time constant

Parameter.Comment: Time to increase from 0 to 1 pu output at 1 pu input signal. Increase from 0 to either positive or negative value.
Parameter.Name: Udcref Ramp Time increase

Parameter.Comment: Time to decrease from 1 pu output to 0 pu with a 0 pu input signal. The same decrease time used from -1 pu to 0 pu.
Parameter.Name: Udcref Ramp Time decrease

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the output of the ram-filter and the actual dc-link voltage is larger then max deviation, the output of the ramp-filter will not change.
Parameter.Name: Max Udc deviation

Parameter.Comment: If the difference between the input and output of the ramp-filter is less than this value, the filter will become a 1st order lowpass filter.
Parameter.Name: Max Udcref error

Parameter.Comment: 0: Udcref Ramp filter is not allowed, but a 1st order lowpass filter. 1: Udcref Ramp filter is allowed.
Parameter.Name: Udcref Ramp Allowed

Parameter.Comment: 0: Also 1st order lowpass filter can be selected 1: Only Ramp-filter is selected if allowed
Parameter.Name: Udcref Ramp Fixed Selected

Parameter.Comment: 0: Internal, i.e. local, Udcref selected 1: External Udcref from PLC selected
Parameter.Name: External Udcref Selected

Parameter.Comment: Local DC-link voltage reference in Volt
Parameter.Name: Local Udcref

Parameter.Comment: Offset for the voltage reference if offset error in measurements. This may be needed to be adjusted in case of droop control to have correct sharing of power between units.
Parameter.Name: Udcref Offset

Parameter.Comment: Max allowed DC-link voltage reference
Parameter.Name: Max Udcref

Parameter.Comment: Minimum Allowed DC-link Voltage reference
Parameter.Name: Min Udcref

Parameter.Comment: This is the constant power reference used in the droop correction term in DC-link Voltage droop control. Usually this value is selected to be zero. Please note that her positive value is generator power.
Parameter.Name: Power Reference

Parameter.Comment: Droop gain k_droop_PG in pu.
Parameter.Name: Droop gain for power

Parameter.Comment: This is the proportional gain in the PI(D)controller
Parameter.Name: Gain Kp Udc Controller

Parameter.Comment: Feedforward term is usually not used in the UDC controller
Parameter.Name: Feedforward Gain Kv UDC Controller

Parameter.Comment: Integral time constant in PI(D) controller. Can be calculated based on modification of Symmetrical Optimum.
Parameter.Name: Integral Time constant Udc Controller

Parameter.Comment: Used when going out of limitation of the controller. Not in use in this version of the controller.
Parameter.Name: Filter Time Udc Controller

Parameter.Comment: This is the limit for the DC-link voltage in Converter 1 when the Application State Machine is allowed to go to the READY_TO_SWITCH_ON state
Parameter.Name: Udc Start Limit

Parameter.Comment: This is the limit for the DC-link voltage in Converter 2 when the Application State machine is allowed to go to the READY_TO_SWITCH_ON state
Parameter.Name: Udc2 Start Limit

Parameter.Comment: Positive torque limit Tmax should limit the torque reference used to 0 pu, or even negative, to avoid overspeed. Working i 1st and 4th quadrants in the torque speed plane.
Parameter.Name: Speed Max

Parameter.Comment: Negative torque limit Tmin should limit the torque reference used to 0 pu, or even positive value, to avoid underspeed. Working in 3rd and 2nd quadrants in the torque speed plane.
Parameter.Name: Speed Min

Parameter.Comment: This is the slope of the torque limiter function. The function is a straight line with negative slope (minus-sign in the equation). The same slope is used both for Tmin and Tmax -functions.
Parameter.Name: dT_dSpeed_slope

Parameter.Comment: Used in the torque limiter functions. Converter to pu in the routine. Will limit the braking torque.
Parameter.Name: Udc max

Parameter.Comment: Used in the torque limiter function. Will limit the motoring torque.
Parameter.Name: Udc min

Parameter.Comment:
Slope of torque limiter function as function of the DC-link voltage.
Braking torque is limited towards zero to avoid over-voltage. It can be forced a bit over in motor mode to discharge the dc-link capacitor. The limit is Udc max.
Motoring torque can be reduced to avoid under-voltage. It can be forced a bit into braking torque to charge/ keep the dc-link voltage. The limit is Udc min.
Parameter.Name: dT_dUdc slope

Parameter.Comment: This is the maximum torque the generating torque limit can be forced into the motoring torque value.
Parameter.Name: Te_max Udc

Parameter.Comment: This is the minimum torque the motoring torque limit can be forced into generating torque value.
Parameter.Name: Te_min Udc

Parameter.Comment: This is the maximum motoring Power allowed. This means that, for the actual speed, the torque has to be limited.
Parameter.Name: P max

Parameter.Comment: This is the limit for the braking power, i.e. power from the drive to the source. Thus the braking torque has to be limited.
Parameter.Name: P min

Parameter.Comment: This is the max torque allowed in the drive independent of power, dc-link voltage and speed.
Parameter.Name: Te max

Parameter.Comment: This is the most negative torque allowed independent on other limiter functions.
Parameter.Name: Te min

Parameter.Comment:
When a torque limit is reduced, that happens instantly. The torque limit is released slowly to avoid oscillations. This is especially important for the DC-link voltage limiter.
The time slope filter is the ramping time from 0 to 1 pu.
Parameter.Name: Tlim slope filter

Parameter.Comment: Time constant in a 1st order filter for measured/estimated speed.
Parameter.Name: Time Speed filter

Parameter.Comment:
This factor can be used to change the gain of the PI controller.
The current controllers are tuned according to Modulus Optimum. This means that the integral time constant of the PI controller is selected to cancel the armature time constant Ta.
The gain is chosen to give a relative damping of 1/sqrt(2). The formula for the gain is then: Kp= la/(factorTimeDelay*Tsamp)
Parameter.Name: factor Time delay armature

Parameter.Comment:
Kp=Tf/(factorTimeDelay*Tsamp)
Tf is the time constant of the field winding.
Parameter.Name: factor Time delay field

Parameter.Comment: Type of machine: 1: Separately Excited DC machine 2: 3-phase Induction Motor 4: 3-phase Permanent Magnet Machine 8: Separately Excited Synchronous Machine 16: 6-phase Permanent Magnet Machine 32: 6-phase Induction Motor
Parameter.Name: Type of machine

Parameter.Comment: Rated armature voltage
Parameter.Name: UaN

Parameter.Comment: Rated armature current
Parameter.Name: IaN

Parameter.Comment:
The rated voltage is UfN=Rf*IfN. IfN is the current which gives the voltage EaN in no-load and at rated speed.
EaN=UaN-Ra*IaN
Parameter.Name: UfN

Parameter.Comment: The field current which gives EaN at rated speed and no-load.
Parameter.Name: IfN

Parameter.Comment: Rated mechanical speed i rpm
Parameter.Name: Nn

Parameter.Comment: Ohmic resistance in the armature winding
Parameter.Name: Ra

Parameter.Comment: Inductance in the armature winding. Often in the mH or uH range.
Parameter.Name: La

Parameter.Comment: Time constant in the field winding Lf/Rf. Usually quite large.
Parameter.Name: Tf

Parameter.Comment: Max allowed current in the armature winding in pu.
Parameter.Name: ia max

Parameter.Comment:
Max allowed current in the field winding in pu. This only dynamically.
In practice the current reference will be limited by the flux allowed, while psi_af=if in pu.
Parameter.Name: if max

Parameter.Comment:
This parameter decides how to use the three bridge legs in the converter.
In this DC drive the value is fixed to 2, which means: Bridge less A and B is used as full bridge converter for the armature winding. Bridge leg C is used as Buck-converter for the field winding.
Parameter.Name: Converter Topology

Parameter.Comment: A 12 bit AD-converter is used , The current is both positive and negative. If Imax [A] to measured is 125 A this factor becomes: 2047/125 =16.376 bit/A
Parameter.Name: bit_pr_Amp Armature

Parameter.Comment: If Imax [A] to be measured is 2.5 A, this means: 2047/2.5 = 818.8 bit/A
Parameter.Name: Bit_pr_Amp Fieldwinding

Parameter.Comment: If the max voltage to be measured is 400 Vdc, this means: 2047/400= 5.12 bit/V
Parameter.Name: bit_pr_Volt DC-link

Parameter.Comment:
This is the trip value used in the FPGA at very high time resolution. This means may be 100-1000 times pr. interrupt of the controller routine., i.e. each time a new AD-result is ready.
The max value should be LESS that the maximum current that can be measured by the AD-converter: 2047/(bit_pr_Amp)
Parameter.Name: FW Tripp Ia

Parameter.Comment: This is the tripp limit, Fault Limit, used in SW. Usually we like to trip the drive for over-current in SW instead of HW. That is why this value is lower that the FW Tripp value.
Parameter.Name: Fault Ia

Parameter.Comment:
This is the warning value of the armature current. If the current is above this value, a warning bit is set in the Warning Word of the converter. When it becomes below this value, the warning bit is cleared.
This value should be smaller that the Fault value.
Parameter.Name: Warning Ia

Parameter.Comment:
This is the current limit used in the torque limiter chain of the motor drive. To avoid tripping the drive, the torque reference is limited to avoid over-current in the armature converter and motor.
This value should be lower that tripp/Fault limits and usually less or equal Warning limit.
Parameter.Name: Limit value Ia

Parameter.Comment: As for the armature winding, the FW trip level for the field current has to be below the max measurable field current given by the AD-converter: 2047/(bit_pr_Amp)
Parameter.Name: FW Tripp If

Parameter.Comment: This SW trip Fault value should be less than the HW Tripp value.
Parameter.Name: Fault If

Parameter.Comment: This value should be less than the SW Fault limit.
Parameter.Name: Warning If

Parameter.Comment: This limit value should be less than the SW Fault value. This value is used to limit the field current reference value to avoid tripp of the drive and thus get a more robust drive.
Parameter.Name: Limit value If

Parameter.Comment: This tripp limit is selected to protect the DC-link capacitors in the drive from over-voltage. It is, as for current measurements, important to limit the value within the measurement range of the AD-converter: 2047/(bit_per_V)
Parameter.Name: FW Tripp Udc

Parameter.Comment: This is the minimum voltage allowed during ordinary operation. If the DC-link voltage becomes less than this value, a bit in the Converter Fault Word is set an the drive is tripped.
Parameter.Name: Fault Udcmin

Parameter.Comment: A bit in the Converter Warning Word is set if the DC-link voltage is above this value. If the voltage decreases below this value, the bit is cleared.
Parameter.Name: Warning Udcmax

Parameter.Comment: A bit in the Warning Word is set if the DC-link voltage becomes less that this value. This limit should be higher than the Fault Udcmin value.
Parameter.Name: Warning Udcmin

Parameter.Comment:
Converter 2 is NOT USED in this version of the DC drive.
In some other implementations, the converter 2 can be selected as Full Bridge converter for the field winding, i.e. topology=1.
Parameter.Name: Converter Topology 2

Parameter.Comment: The DC-link voltage value for converter 1 used during emulation. This is the value the DC-link is initialized to. New values can be written to the emulator by help of WatchView during emulation.
Parameter.Name: Udc1

Parameter.Comment: This is for Converter 2. In the standard DC software, converter 2 is not in use.
Parameter.Name: Udc2

Parameter.Comment:
This is the mechanical time constant in the pu model at the motor shaft.
Tm*dn/dt=te-tL J*dOmega/dt=Te_TL
Tm=J*OmegaN^2/Pn = (2*H)
Recall that Tm is based on the total equivalent Inertia, not only the motor.
Parameter.Name: Tm

Parameter.Comment:
This is the constant for a quadratic load: tL= sign(n)*kn*n^2
This load is implemented in HW. If SW Emulator is used, this value is set to kn=0.
Parameter.Name: kn

Parameter.Comment: 0: Pump 1: Electric Vehicle 2: Ship Propulsion 3: Wind Power 4: Hydro Power
Parameter.Name: Type of Load

Parameter.Comment: This is the load constant kL in the torque equation for a pump load. The speed is in rpm. T_L= sign(speed)*kL*speed^2 [Nm]
Parameter.Name: Load Constant

Parameter.Comment: This is a constant load torque, which can be added to the quadratic load as follows: tL=sign(speed)*kL*speed^2 + t_constant
Parameter.Name: Constant load

Parameter.Comment: The PLC has to update the Watch Dog timer with this value regularly. If updating is stopped, the Watch Dog Timer counts down to zero and gives a Warning or Fault in the Application Fault Word.
Parameter.Name: Mod Bus Time

Parameter.Comment: Bit 0: Switch On Bit 1: Voltage Enable Bit 2: Not Quick Stop Bit 3: Operation Enable Bit 4: Ramp Enable Bit 5: Ramp Accel Bit 6: Enable Set point Bit 7: Reset Malfunction Bit 8: Reserved Bit 9: Reserved Bit 10: Remote Bit 11: Torque Control Bit 12: Speed Control Bit 13: Power Control Bit 14: DC-link Voltage Control Bit 15: Load Emulator
Parameter.Name: Control Word

Parameter.Comment: 0: Torque Control 1: Speed Control 2: Power Control 3: DC-link Voltage Control 4: Load Emulator
Parameter.Name: Control Mode

Parameter.Comment: Max Power Allowed from Source to the Drive
Parameter.Name: Max Power (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Max Power allowed to be transferred from Drive to the Source. Power from the Drive to the Source is a negative value.
Parameter.Name: Min Power (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Power Reference in pu x 1000
Parameter.Name: Power Ref (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Udclink Ref (Volt) is equal Udc_V *10. Udclink Ref (Volt) = 2000 becomes 200.0 V in processor.
Parameter.Name: Udclink Ref (Volt)

Parameter.Comment: Torque Ref (pu) equal 1000 becomes 1.0 in the processor.
Parameter.Name: Torque Ref (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Speed Ref (pu) equal 1000 becomes 1.0 in processor
Parameter.Name: Speed Ref (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Constant Torque (pu) equal 1000 becomes 1.0 pu in processor. Not used by the Application Layer, but in the Load Emulator in the FirmWare Layer. This is constant load parameter to be used in emulator, if enabled by help of a Configuration Parameter.
Parameter.Name: Constant Torque (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Bit 01: Ready To Switch On
Parameter.Name: Application Status Word

Parameter.Comment: Bit 00: aa
Parameter.Name: Application Warning Word

Parameter.Comment: Bit 00: aa
Parameter.Name: Application Fault Word

Parameter.Comment: Bit 00: limit
Parameter.Name: Application Limit Word

Parameter.Comment: Not Ready To Switch On = 0 Switch On Disabled = 64 Ready To Switch On = 33 Switched On = 35 Operation Enabled = 39 Quick Stop Active = 7 Malfunction Reaction Active = 40 TestRun = 48
Parameter.Name: Actual Application State

Parameter.Comment: Control Modes. 0: Torque Control 1: Speed Control 2: Power Control 3: DC-link Voltage Control 4: Load Emulator
Parameter.Name: Actual Control Mode

Parameter.Comment: Mechanical Speed of the Motor
Parameter.Name: Actual Speed (rpm)

Parameter.Comment: Speed of motor in pu.
Parameter.Name: Actual Speed (pu)

Parameter.Comment: The torque reference after the torque reference limiter function
Parameter.Name: Torque Ref Used (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Calculated based on a Motor Model
Parameter.Name: Torque Actual (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Can be of interest if some controllers are implemented in the PLC.
Parameter.Name: Torque Limit Max Used (pu)

Parameter.Comment: Can be of interest if some controllers are implemented in the PLC.
Parameter.Name: Torque Limit Min Used (pu)
